Package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command

Class SchedulerTestHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.SchedulerTestHelper
  • public class SchedulerTestHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Implement a very skinny command runner that enables easy unit test of a command.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SchedulerTestHelper()
      Default constructor initialized runner heartbeat to 20 ms
      SchedulerTestHelper​(int heartbeatMilliseconds)
      Initialized a runner with your own heartbeat (in ms)

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Do not let an instance to this class go to the garbage collector without calling the destroy method first. It will hang your application until the instance is garbage collected due to the use of the executor service.

      • run

        public SchedulerTestHelper run​(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Command commandToRun)
        Run a command. Use the duration method to say how long.
        Parameters:
        commandToRun - Inherited WPILib command to run
        Returns:
        This test helper so you can chain forDuration.

      • forDuration

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<?> forDuration​(int seconds)
                                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Make an asynchronous call to kick off the scheduler. We do it this way so that you can interrupt the Future that is returned, in case you want to unit test your command getting interrupted (which is common).
        Parameters:
        seconds - Number of seconds to run your command
        Returns:
        A Future that can be awaited for scheduler completion or cancelled
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
